column4: When the Zika virus swept across the country of Colombia, NPR sent me there with a global health reporter. We sent back these gripping stories.
Prescription drugs are getting more expensive – and it’s happening much faster than inflation. I wrote this app to help journalists pinpoint how and why.
On October 23, 2015, the major natural gas company in Los Angeles discovered an enormous methane leak. I spearheaded our coverage.

The biggest environmental story in California has been the devastating five-year drought. In stories like this one about a desalination plant in Santa Barbara, I helped explain and humanize the crisis.
